name: Palatino Grand Hotel Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was clean. Room small, but who stays in the room in Rome? Near coliseum, palatine hill, and roman forum. Some of the staff were very helpful.
reviews.title: Adequate hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We walked in off the street to check this place as an alternative to the unsatisfactory apartment we had intended to stay in. We were agreeably surprised by the rate (Euro 150 per room incl breakfast), delighted by the rooms, and moved straight in.
reviews.title: Great base for a city break

likes.liked: — quality of rooms at the price paid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had one of the upgraded rooms, almost a mini-suite, and it was superb. Beautifully cleaned, very quiet, all the amenities.
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.text: Breakfast was fine and varied. The hotel had put independent travellers in a separate room from the tour groups, which was a blessing.
reviews.title: A week at the Palatino
Huge disappointment
reviews.text: Location is superb. Colosseum, Forum, St Pietri in Vincoli all in easy walk. Metro station very close by, buses galore, and the main Termini rail station only 15 minutes away.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Palatino Dec 2006 for the new year celebrations in Rome. I am extremely fussy but would recommend this hotel. Found the hotel overall to be ideally located as it was only a ten minute walk from the Termini train stn and then we spent the weekend walking round central Rome sightseeing. The colosseum is less than five minutes away ! The hotel was very well presented and the rooms a very good size with lovely fluffy white towels in the bathroom and pristine crisp white sheets on the bed. The only down side i found to our room was a very firm mattress, something i am not use to and there was no tea/coffee facilities in the room but there was a mini bar which we used to chill our own drinks. The hotel breakfast was an excellent buffet with a great choice of hot and cold food (scrambled eggs, bacon, ham, cheeses,salmon,fruit,cereal and pastries) Didnt try the hotel restaurant at night as there are lots of choices right outside the hotel (Indian, Chinese and Italian) not to forget a very friendly irish bar at the rear of the hotel. Cavour metro stop is also right at the back of the hotel for those of you wanting to use the metro.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 5 nights here and found it to be very comfortable and location is great. We walked all over Rome from here. Restaurants on street behind hotel are plain but good. Elite grocery is across the street and to the right. Much cheaper for water, soda and snacks than mini bar. Cafe on corner to the right has gelato and big cappacinos.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would return anytime.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a good 3*, very clean, nice decor, nice breakfast, fantastic location very close to the Termini (15mins walk) and Colleseum (5mins walk). Also close to several nice tavernas and cafe bars - in which to soak up the Roman atmosphere. I would have no qualms returning or recommending the hotel.
reviews.title: Great place for tourists to stay
Great Location in Rome
reviews.text: Only down point is very minor - only english channels available were CNN & MTV - but who goes to Rome to watch TV?!

reviews.title: Enjoyable- good location
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location for the ruins and Colesseum. We walked through most of the city on the site seeing. The Vatican is a little far to walk to, but it is doable. The hotel room was roomy enough for 3 adults. The breakfast was decent- no fresh fruit when we were at the hotel. Front desk was very helpful with tours and directions.

This was a typical large-scale hotel catering to hordes of tourist groups (you will surely meet them during breakfast). We got a pretty decent deal (paying 150 Euros for a triple room). The room was very spacious (compared to say, a room in Paris) and the bathroom was huge. It was very clean as well. Breakfast was decent. The location was excellent as it's situated in the heart of the ancient center of Rome, just a short walk away from the Coliseum (Colosseo) and the Imperial Forums. It's also not too far from Termini Train Station. If you manage to get a good deal, do stay here otherwise if you're gonna pay a bomb, you're better off staying in other fancier places with much more character and class.
reviews.title: Big, bold and brassy

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in may as part of a Colette Vacation tour....so we did not have any choice about the hotel since it was selected as part of the tour....as everyone else has stated, the location is very good, about two blocks for the colosseum, and two blocks from the forum...it is on a main street but our room was in the back and quiet...the rooms are very ordinary, apparently they have not updated them for at least 20 years. but the room was very clean....the bath was adequate but on the second day there was no water from 5:00 PM until midnight...now, maybe that was because everyone on our tour, all 50 of us, decided to take showers before supper...but this is a tourist hotel and they should be set up to accommodate this kind of thing...we were not the only tour group there at the time, there was at least one other group.....the staff is not very friendly or helpful so don't expect much there....the breakfast was very typical, and located in a fairly large room that is set up for tour groups....there is a fairly nice bar at the hotel and nicely appointed lounge chairs in the lobby area..... In looking at earlier reviews, a restaurant behind the hotel, Roma, was mentioned as a good place to go, so we went there but we were disappointed, I would not go back there...down the street towards the forum, there were a few restaurants that looked like they might have been a better choice..overall, I would not spend serious money to stay here but if you can get a deal, it is in a very good location if you want to see some of the old rome attractions.
reviews.title: Good location but
Great Location, but Not Worth 4 Stars
reviews.text: What makes this hotel "grand"? The location. It's two and a half blocks from the Colosseum and the Roman Forum. There are a number of nice little cafes within 5 minutes' walking distance, a coffee shop a few doors down, and a market 50 yards away. St. Peter in Chains is right across the street. The breakfast buffet was extensive and tasty. On the other hand, the dinners at the hotel were mediocre, the staff was not overly friendly, and the fuse in our bedroom kept blowing. I wish I had a dollar for each time I had to reset the breaker. Would I stay there again? Probably, but only because of the location.
Hotel room and toilet is quite roomy considerating you are in Rome. Breakfast was slightly dissappointed since you have to pay extra 15 Euro to get hot breakfast (egg, meat, etc).
reviews.title: Close to Coloseum, Roman Forum and metro
Great trip !
reviews.text: Location was terrifiic! We walked everywhere except to Vatican City, which we very easily got to via the Metro (station was 50 metres from the hotel). Having said that, if you were feeling energetic even that was walkable. Hotel was very clean and staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very good. We made good use of an Irish Bar that was right next to the hotel (out the back). Couldn't really fault the hotel or the location and would definately recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Rome.

This hotel was an average experience overall. The hotel overall - was OK- the rooms were comfortable and the location was good. However, for the price I paid (about $350 per night) I found this hotel to be extremely overrated and not worth the money. There was nothing special about the rooms, they are average. The location is pretty good - 10 minute walk to the forum and colosseum; other sights are a 15 minute walk away. The subway station is close by as well. The major problem we had was that the AC did not work in our room, and the hotel preferred to "fix rather than give us a new room." It was only after we insisted on a new room that it was given to us. The hotel staff was not helpful through this process and one person at the desk rudely asked us "why are you here?". The staff was also not very knowledgeable about sights and information and we were given incorrect information a few times. I would not stay here again.
reviews.title: An Average Hotel
The Grand Palatino Hotel - Good Choice
reviews.text: I just returned from a week-long trip to Rome and stayed at the Grand Palatino Hotel. It is at a great location, located down the block from the Metro station (via Cavour) and one stop away from the main Termini station, which is walkable, but not suggested with luggage. The Colosseum, Forum and Palatine Hill is only about 10 minutes away. There is also a bus stop a few steps away, but not sure what bus # stops there.

The rooms are kept clean with hairdryer, safe, refrigerator and usual amenities of shampoos, soaps, shoe polisher, etc, which are re-stocked daily. We had a triple bed room which was very comfortable. The hotel is however on a very busy street, so do expect traffic noise when the windows are open, especially if your room is facing the front and if you are there over a weekend.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: Lots of restaurants closeby (behind on the small streets). They do serve a good daily breakfast spread (scrambled eggs, bacon, sliced coldcuts, smoked salmon, croissants, danishs, bread, cereals, fruit, etc).
reviews.title: Location, Location, LOCATION!!!!

description: The Grand Hotel Palatino is situated in the heart of the ancient center of Rome, just a short walk away from the Coliseum and Imperial Forums. Close to shopping streets where Rome's most elegant shops can be found and near Termini Railway station, the air terminal and main subway station, providing rapid links to all the most important areas of Rome. Palatino Grand Hotel has 208 large rooms, 2 restaurants, 1 bar, 4 meeting rooms.
